definition: to force entrance into/to score a goal (sport)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The former Danubio youngster then reflected on his goal against Juventus.
sentences.chinese: 这位前达努比奥的年轻人谈到了对尤文时攻入的进球。

sentences.english: Diego Milito with a goal five minutes before half-time.
sentences.chinese: 迭戈米利托在半场结束五分钟前攻入了全场唯一入球。

sentences.english: And then he gave the assist for the third goal by Inzaghi.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还助攻因扎吉攻入了第三粒进球。

sentences.english: He had performed brilliantly and capped it off with the clinching goal.
sentences.chinese: 他在决赛中表现出色，并攻入决定性的进球。

sentences.english: He scored 33 goals in 35 appearances in his first season at the Bernabeu.
sentences.chinese: 在伯纳乌的处子赛季，他便出场35次攻入33球。

sentences.english: In the lane he scored on power drop steps and right handed jump hooks over his left shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 在他攻入了对权力的下降和右撇子步跳投了他的左肩。

sentences.english: I hope I can score my first goal at Olimpico infront of our tifosi.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我可以在球迷面前攻入我的首粒奥林匹克进球。

sentences.english: He has played 51 games for Sampdoria, scoring 1 goal.
sentences.chinese: 他为桑普出场51次并攻入一球。

sentences.english: Caricola is trying to clear the danger only succeeded in putting the ball in his own net.
sentences.chinese: 卡里科拉试图解除威胁，结果将球攻入了本方网内。

sentences.english: Most of the goals I have scored are down to the words of advice from Rodolfo.
sentences.chinese: 我攻入的大部分入球都得益于博雷尔的忠告。

sentences.english: Protestersbuilt barricades and tried to use garbage cans as battering rams tobreak their way into thenational palace.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者堆起路障，试着用垃圾桶当槌以攻入总统府。

sentences.english: The Uruguayan striker Diego Forlan scored the decisive goal in the 116th minute.
sentences.chinese: 乌拉圭前锋弗兰在第116分钟攻入了制胜的一球。

sentences.english: The doctor is still red blood transfusion, the Japanese army invaded, refused to Sheshang parasitic red.
sentences.chinese: 医生为尚红输血时，日军攻入，寄生拒绝舍尚红而去。

sentences.english: Baggio scored 17 goals in 32 league matches this season.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛季他在32场联赛中攻入17球。

sentences.english: It was the second time this year Hucles scored an injury-time winner.
sentences.chinese: 这是胡可思今年内第二次在补时阶段攻入制胜球。

sentences.english: Davor made 39 appearances over the following season, scoring 11 goals.
sentences.chinese: 在那个赛季中，苏克共出场39次，攻入11球。

definition: to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
